She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

249
00:24:17,747 --> 00:24:19,987
I don't have any dolls.

250
00:24:20,067 --> 00:24:23,307
Get some food, huh?

251
00:24:23,347 --> 00:24:26,226
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

252
00:24:31,705 --> 00:24:35,225
- "Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police."
- ( Laughing )

253
00:24:44,824 --> 00:24:47,943
Thirty, forty dollars.

254
00:24:49,623 --> 00:24:51,983
Who the fuck is this now?

255
00:24:52,023 --> 00:24:56,022
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

256
00:24:56,102 --> 00:24:58,662
- Cerrado!
- ( Pounding )

257
00:24:58,742 --> 00:25:02,421
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

258
00:25:07,701 --> 00:25:09,620

259
00:25:09,700 --> 00:25:13,780
Goddamn creatures of the night,
they never learn.

260
00:25:15,420 --> 00:25:17,099
Hey! Hey!

261
00:25:19,059 --> 00:25:21,059

- ( Screams )

262
00:25:21,139 --> 00:25:25,338
"Suddenly I heard

263
00:25:25,378 --> 00:25:29,178
gently rapping,
rapping at my chamber door."

264
00:25:31,058 --> 00:25:33,257
What are you talking about?

265
00:25:33,337 --> 00:25:35,937
You heard me rapping, right?

266
00:25:36,017 --> 00:25:39,976
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fucking new door!

267
00:25:42,296 --> 00:25:45,136
I'm looking for something

268
00:25:45,216 --> 00:25:46,535
Gold.

269
00:25:46,615 --> 00:25:48,855
You're looking for a coroner,

270
00:25:52,935 --> 00:25:57,854
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

271
00:25:57,934 --> 00:26:00,374
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

272
00:26:06,253 --> 00:26:08,413
- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

273
00:26:08,493 --> 00:26:10,652
You're not paying attention.

274
00:26:13,452 --> 00:26:15,532
No! ( Screaming )

275
00:26:15,612 --> 00:26:20,691
I repeat, a gold
engagement ring, yes?

276
00:26:22,251 --> 00:26:25,570
It was pawned here a year ago
by a customer of yours named Tin Tin.

277
00:26:28,170 --> 00:26:31,689
He confided in me
before he ran out of breath.

278
00:26:31,769 --> 00:26:34,809

279
00:26:36,769 --> 00:26:38,688
Who's this sack of shit?

280
00:26:38,768 --> 00:26:41,608
That's Tin Tin, one of
T-bird's little helpers.

281
00:26:41,688 --> 00:26:44,608
I think you can rule out

282
00:26:44,688 --> 00:26:47,367
Don't any of your street demons

283

This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't
look like your usual gang crap.

284
00:26:51,527 --> 00:26:56,046
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

285
00:26:56,126 --> 00:26:57,966
I'm suppose to thank you
for that, right?

286
00:26:58,046 --> 00:27:01,645
Word to the wise:
Watch your fucking mouth.

287
00:27:02,805 --> 00:27:05,125
What the hell
do you call that?

288
00:27:06,125 --> 00:27:08,604
I call it blood, detective.

289
00:27:08,684 --> 00:27:12,324
I suppose you'll write it up

290
00:27:12,364 --> 00:27:15,044
You can leave
my crime scene now, okay?

291
00:27:15,084 --> 00:27:18,923

292
00:27:21,483 --> 00:27:24,282

- What are you doing?

293
00:27:24,362 --> 00:27:26,882
- Don't you know this game?
- What game?

294
00:27:26,922 --> 00:27:29,722
Okay, the rings!
I'll tell you about the rings!

295
00:27:29,802 --> 00:27:34,001
They're in that metal box!
It's under the shelf there!

296
00:27:34,081 --> 00:27:39,360
Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

297
00:27:42,800 --> 00:27:45,280
- Look, it goes to the attic.
- Okay.

298
00:27:54,078 --> 00:27:55,998
No, no.

299
00:27:56,078 --> 00:27:59,078
No, no, no.

300
00:28:01,477 --> 00:28:05,517
Oh, it's beautiful.
I don't believe it.

301
00:28:09,276 --> 00:28:11,556
Shelly.

302
00:28:19,395 --> 00:28:20,715
I love you.

303
00:28:25,594 --> 00:28:28,354
( Groaning )

304
00:28:28,434 --> 00:28:31,233
- You have one chance to live.
- Take anything you want.

305
00:28:31,313 --> 00:28:34,273

- Take anything!

306
00:28:34,353 --> 00:28:37,073
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

307
00:28:37,153 --> 00:28:39,672

little party pals.

308
00:28:39,752 --> 00:28:42,032
The Pit. They all
hang out at The Pit.

309
00:28:42,112 --> 00:28:46,991
T-birds's little potato-heads hang out
there. Funboy lives there upstairs.

310
00:28:47,071 --> 00:28:49,951
- Funboy.
- Oh, baby, oh.

311
00:28:50,031 --> 00:28:53,630
- A whole jolly club...
- Please!

312
00:28:53,710 --> 00:28:56,350
- with jolly pirate nicknames!
- Stop! Please!

313
00:28:56,430 --> 00:28:58,990
- Jesus Christ in a taxicab!
- Hold still!

314
00:29:00,589 --> 00:29:03,829
Each one of these is a life...

315
00:29:03,909 --> 00:29:06,309

316
00:29:06,389 --> 00:29:08,908
I'm begging you.
Don't kill me.

317
00:29:08,948 --> 00:29:12,508
I'm not gonna kill you.

318
00:29:12,588 --> 00:29:16,587
Your job will be to tell the rest
of them that death is coming for them...

319
00:29:16,627 --> 00:29:20,027

320
00:29:24,866 --> 00:29:28,906
Tell them Eric Draven

321
00:29:30,705 --> 00:29:34,625
You walk outta here,
they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

322
00:29:34,705 --> 00:29:38,184
You're nothing but street grease,
you motherfucker!

323
00:29:38,264 --> 00:29:40,304
Is that gasoline I smell?

324
00:29:40,384 --> 00:29:43,224
No, man, no!
No!

325
00:29:43,264 --> 00:29:45,264
No!

326
00:29:45,304 --> 00:29:46,583
No!

327
00:29:49,503 --> 00:29:52,023
( Screaming )

328
00:29:55,222 --> 00:29:59,862
( Screaming )

329
00:30:01,621 --> 00:30:04,941
It's on the house, kiddo,

330
00:30:05,021 --> 00:30:07,221
One root beer.

331
00:30:09,140 --> 00:30:11,780

332
00:30:11,860 --> 00:30:16,139
Your mom... technically,
she's off right now.

333
00:30:16,219 --> 00:30:18,259
Yeah, way off.

334
00:30:19,379 --> 00:30:22,579

335
00:30:22,659 --> 00:30:27,378
Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

336
00:30:27,418 --> 00:30:30,337
I thought the police
always said, "Freeze!"

337
00:30:30,417 --> 00:30:34,177
I am the police and I say don't move,
Snow White. You move, you're dead.

338
00:30:34,257 --> 00:30:39,216
And I say I'm dead and I move.

339
00:30:39,256 --> 00:30:42,456
Not one more step.
I'm serious.

340
00:30:42,496 --> 00:30:46,695
Then shoot, if you will,
Officer Albrecht.

341
00:30:46,775 --> 00:30:49,775
What are you, nuts?
Walking into a gun?

342
00:30:49,855 --> 00:30:51,495
You high?

343

- You don't remember me?
- What are you talking about?

344
00:30:54,694 --> 00:30:58,534
How about Shelly?
Do you remember Shelly Webster?

345
00:30:58,614 --> 00:31:01,173
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

346
00:31:01,213 --> 00:31:05,653
I want you to move over to the curb,
nice and easy. Move it!

347
00:31:05,693 --> 00:31:10,332
Okay, we're gonna
wait here for backup.

348
00:31:10,412 --> 00:31:14,692
- It's getting too weird for me.
- Oh, it gets better.

349
00:31:14,772 --> 00:31:17,091
Do you know someone named T-bird?

350
00:31:17,171 --> 00:31:21,571
He had a friend who shouldn't have

351
00:31:21,651 --> 00:31:24,130
You're the guy
that murdered Tin Tin.

352
00:31:24,210 --> 00:31:27,570
- ( Looter ) Check it out.
- He was already dead.

353
00:31:27,650 --> 00:31:32,769
- ( Glass Shattering )
- He died a year ago.
The moment he touched her.

354
00:31:32,849 --> 00:31:36,369
They're all dead.
They just don't know it yet.

355
00:31:36,449 --> 00:31:38,768
Get away from there!

356
00:31:38,848 --> 00:31:41,848
Cops!
Get outta here!

357
00:31:41,888 --> 00:31:45,167
- ( Woman Laughing )
- ( Looter ) Leave it, run!

358
00:31:50,327 --> 00:31:54,486
- Oh, great, great.
- ( Siren Wailing )

359
00:31:54,566 --> 00:31:57,046
Guy shows up looking like

360
00:31:57,126 --> 00:31:59,326

right out in the open.

361
00:31:59,406 --> 00:32:05,005
Well, at least he didn't do that walking
against the wind shit. I hate that.

362
00:32:05,085 --> 00:32:08,844
Little early
for Devil's Night.

363
00:32:10,364 --> 00:32:12,964
You are very restless.

364
00:32:13,044 --> 00:32:16,123
Just wish I was a little
hungry again, that's all.

365
00:32:16,203 --> 00:32:20,283
- Be careful of what you ask for.
- Yeah, I may get it, I know.

366
00:32:23,722 --> 00:32:26,202
( Sizzling )

367
00:32:26,282 --> 00:32:29,761
** ( Rock And Roll, Indistinct )

368
00:32:31,281 --> 00:32:34,201
There are energies

369
00:32:34,281 --> 00:32:36,641
Seeing is believing,
isn't it?

370
00:32:43,280 --> 00:32:46,919
( Door Opening, Closing )

371
00:32:46,999 --> 00:32:49,879
Mmm, yummy.

372
00:32:54,998 --> 00:32:58,798
Gideon's pawnshop just burned down

373
00:32:58,878 --> 00:33:01,957
Nobody cleared
this little event with me.

374
00:33:02,037 --> 00:33:03,717
I didn't have nothing
to do with that.

375
00:33:03,797 --> 00:33:06,357

awfully disappointed.

376
00:33:06,437 --> 00:33:09,636
I got trouble.
One of my crew got himself perished.

377
00:33:09,676 --> 00:33:11,876
- Yeah, who might that be?
- Tin Tin.

378
00:33:11,956 --> 00:33:16,355
Somebody stuck his blades in all his
major organs in alphabetical order.

379
00:33:16,395 --> 00:33:18,875
Gentlemen, by all means,
I think we ought to have...

380
00:33:18,955 --> 00:33:21,994

for poor, old Tin Tin.

381
00:33:24,554 --> 00:33:27,034
You're working for me
tomorrow night, right?

382
00:33:27,114 --> 00:33:29,793
- Whatever you say, I can do.
- Good.

383
00:33:29,833 --> 00:33:32,553
That's very reassuring.

384
00:33:32,593 --> 00:33:36,473
I still ain't heard
why Gideon's burned down.

385
00:33:36,553 --> 00:33:40,832
Is that a natural catastrophe
or act of God or something?

386
00:33:40,912 --> 00:33:42,672
Call it my need to know.

387
00:34:08,508 --> 00:34:10,308
( Sighing )

388
00:34:12,428 --> 00:34:14,827
( Honking, Tires Screeching )

389
00:34:14,907 --> 00:34:17,387
Let go, you creep!

390
00:34:20,587 --> 00:34:22,266
- Nah.
- ( Laughing )

391
00:34:22,346 --> 00:34:25,506
You didn't even slow down,
you dickhead!

392
00:34:26,866 --> 00:34:29,145
He couldn't have stopped.

393
00:34:29,225 --> 00:34:33,345
He was a buttface.
I could have made it.

394
00:34:33,425 --> 00:34:36,345
What are you supposed to be,
a clown or something?

395
00:34:36,425 --> 00:34:38,344
Sometimes.

396
00:34:40,304 --> 00:34:44,863
It's more like surfing than skating.
I wish the rain would stop, just once.

397
00:34:45,983 --> 00:34:49,343
- It can't rain all the time.
- Eric?

398
00:34:58,302 --> 00:35:01,301

399

Don't thank me.
Are we fighting the good fight?

400
00:35:10,060 --> 00:35:14,219
Double homicide a year ago.
No convictions.

401
00:35:14,299 --> 00:35:17,579
Annie... look at that.

402
00:35:17,659 --> 00:35:21,698
"We, the undersigned tenants of
1929 Caulderon Court Apartments--"

403
00:35:21,778 --> 00:35:23,738
What is this, a petition?

404
00:35:23,818 --> 00:35:26,578
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl
who found herself a cause.

405
00:35:26,658 --> 00:35:30,577
- The cause got her killed.
- She was fighting tenant eviction
in that neighborhood?

406
00:35:30,657 --> 00:35:36,297
Shelly Webster and her nice
rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

407
00:35:36,376 --> 00:35:39,776
The last time you snooped around a case
is when you got put back on the beat.

408
00:35:39,856 --> 00:35:43,696
- I know. Torres keeps reminding me.
- I bet he does.

409
00:35:50,415 --> 00:35:54,014
You're going to wind up
working a school crosswalk.

410
00:35:54,054 --> 00:35:56,094
I'm cool.

411
00:35:56,174 --> 00:36:00,733
You didn't get that file from me, okay?
And don't tell me you owe me one.

412
00:36:00,773 --> 00:36:03,173
Ah, I owe you one!

413
00:36:03,253 --> 00:36:05,213
Yeah, right.

414
00:36:05,253 --> 00:36:07,332
Damn.

415
00:36:20,371 --> 00:36:23,690
** ( Rock And Roll )

416
00:36:31,729 --> 00:36:35,449
Tomorrow night
we can get high...

417
00:36:35,529 --> 00:36:39,048
and watch this whole fucking city
burn from that window.

418
00:36:41,768 --> 00:36:44,807
- * I am the park *
- ( Caws )

419
00:36:44,847 --> 00:36:48,327
* I am glow *

420
00:36:48,407 --> 00:36:52,326
* In the motherfucking dark *

421
00:36:52,366 --> 00:36:54,446
* I am shocked *

422
00:36:54,526 --> 00:36:56,646
* And I see *

423
00:36:56,726 --> 00:36:59,765
* I don't want to believe *

424
00:36:59,845 --> 00:37:02,845
* No more *

425
00:37:02,925 --> 00:37:05,445
- There's a big fucking bird over there.
- * No more **

426
00:37:05,485 --> 00:37:07,404
- Huh?
- ( Cawing )

427
00:37:08,524 --> 00:37:11,284
- It's a squab.
- ( Laughing )

428
00:37:11,364 --> 00:37:13,883
Come here, bird.

429
00:37:13,963 --> 00:37:15,963
Hey, bird.
Hey, bird.

430
00:37:16,043 --> 00:37:18,283
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

431
00:37:18,323 --> 00:37:20,843
Here, birdie, birdie.

432
00:37:20,883 --> 00:37:23,762
Come here, birdie,
birdie, birdie.

433
00:37:26,282 --> 00:37:29,361
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

434
00:37:29,441 --> 00:37:31,921
Here, Funboy.

435
00:37:34,161 --> 00:37:36,040
What the fuck?

436
00:37:39,680 --> 00:37:42,120
( Strumming Guitar )

437
00:37:42,160 --> 00:37:46,519
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly
gave me a fucking heart attack!

438
00:37:46,599 --> 00:37:48,679
Look at him.

439
00:37:48,719 --> 00:37:51,478
( Funboy ) Don't sweat it.

440
00:37:53,118 --> 00:37:56,038
It's time for you to take
your bird and leave, freako.

441
00:38:03,637 --> 00:38:08,276
Take your shot, Funboy.
You got me dead bang.

442
00:38:10,196 --> 00:38:14,915
You are seriously fucked up.
Did you look in the mirror?

443
00:38:14,995 --> 00:38:18,355
You need professional help.

444
00:38:20,075 --> 00:38:22,554
- ( Groaning )
- Bingo!

445
00:38:22,634 --> 00:38:25,154
He shoots! He scores!

446
00:38:27,234 --> 00:38:30,113
- ( Cawing )
- ( Laughing )

447
00:38:31,393 --> 00:38:34,833
( Cheering, Laughing )

448
00:38:34,873 --> 00:38:38,432
- Jesus Christ!
- Jesus Christ?

449
00:38:38,512 --> 00:38:41,112
Stop me if you heard this one.

450
00:38:41,192 --> 00:38:43,991
Jesus Christ
walks into a hotel.

451
00:38:44,071 --> 00:38:45,911
( Whimpering )

452
00:38:45,991 --> 00:38:47,711
Ow.

453
00:38:49,191 --> 00:38:51,830
He hands the innkeeper
three nails and he asks...

454
00:38:51,910 --> 00:38:55,310
Don't you ever fucking die?

455
00:38:55,390 --> 00:38:57,550
"Can you put me up for the night?"

456
00:38:57,590 --> 00:39:00,949
( Groaning )

457
00:39:02,829 --> 00:39:07,228
- Does that hurt?
- Fuck. Does it-- Fuck, does it hurt?

458
00:39:07,308 --> 00:39:09,268
Oh, God.

459
00:39:09,348 --> 00:39:13,267
Look what you've done
to my sheets.

460
00:39:15,107 --> 00:39:16,667
( Gun Uncocking )

461
00:39:22,826 --> 00:39:24,506
( Crying )

462
00:39:24,586 --> 00:39:27,985
( Sobbing )

463
00:39:36,504 --> 00:39:38,424
I've got a gun
in my pocket.

464
00:39:41,344 --> 00:39:43,943
You're happy to see me,
aren't you?

465
00:40:00,981 --> 00:40:04,701
Stay away!
Stay away from me!

466
00:40:06,100 --> 00:40:08,260
( Screaming )

467
00:40:12,220 --> 00:40:15,899
Look.

468
00:40:15,939 --> 00:40:20,258
Mother is the name for God
on the lips and hearts of all children.

469
00:40:20,338 --> 00:40:24,898
Do you understand?
Morphine is bad for you.

470
00:40:34,897 --> 00:40:39,496
Your daughter is out there

471
00:41:08,052 --> 00:41:11,572
If I wanted ice,
I would have asked for ice!

472
00:41:11,652 --> 00:41:13,811
Now fill it up!

473
00:41:14,851 --> 00:41:18,091
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

474
00:41:18,171 --> 00:41:20,730
I really need this.

475
00:41:27,010 --> 00:41:28,929
All right.

476
00:41:28,969 --> 00:41:32,769
You burn yourself
playing with matches?

477
00:41:32,809 --> 00:41:35,288
- Fuck off.
- You have an appointment.

478
00:41:35,368 --> 00:41:37,728
- Well, shit on me.
- Drink up.

479
00:41:37,808 --> 00:41:40,608
This is a first.
Do I bow or do I curtsy?

480
00:41:40,688 --> 00:41:43,367
Get my friend here

481
00:41:43,447 --> 00:41:46,727
Oh! Hey, hey, hon!

482
00:41:46,807 --> 00:41:49,607
Hey, good night, Darla.

483
00:41:51,926 --> 00:41:55,486
- You stay put right there.

484
00:42:03,205 --> 00:42:06,524
Get away, steamhead.

485
00:42:22,442 --> 00:42:24,922

486
00:42:25,002 --> 00:42:26,882
Shh.

487
00:42:36,400 --> 00:42:41,920
( Man On Radio ) As you can see, I'm

488
00:42:41,960 --> 00:42:44,599
- ( Door Squeaking )
- the site of last year's biggest
Devil's Night conflagration.

489
00:42:44,679 --> 00:42:47,519
It was exactly one year ago
that the building you see...

490
00:42:47,599 --> 00:42:50,438

was totally demolished by fire.

491
00:42:50,478 --> 00:42:52,558
The fire that was fought
by seven fire companies...

492
00:42:52,638 --> 00:42:54,678
but lost the lives
of two fire fighters.

493
00:42:54,758 --> 00:42:59,317
In fact, if it weren't for the constant
surveillance by the local police--

494
00:42:59,397 --> 00:43:02,197
Freeze!

495
00:43:02,277 --> 00:43:05,636
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

496
00:43:05,676 --> 00:43:07,596
( Whispering ) Fuck.

497
00:43:09,476 --> 00:43:11,556
Good likeness.

498
00:43:11,636 --> 00:43:15,195
I saw your body, man.
You died. You got buried.

499
00:43:15,275 --> 00:43:17,435
You still have your hat on.

500
00:43:21,194 --> 00:43:23,194
I gotta sit down.

501
00:43:23,954 --> 00:43:25,834
Shi--

502
00:43:25,874 --> 00:43:28,633
( Albrecht ) Holy Shit.

503
00:43:30,033 --> 00:43:32,553
Say...

504
00:43:32,633 --> 00:43:36,752
are you some kind of... ghost?

505
00:43:36,832 --> 00:43:38,712
Boo!

506
00:43:45,991 --> 00:43:50,350
I don't know what I am. I need you
to tell me what happened to us.

507
00:43:52,270 --> 00:43:56,190
You took a six-story swan dive
out of a window.

508
00:43:56,270 --> 00:43:59,229
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

509
00:43:59,309 --> 00:44:03,709
Died at the hospital.
Hey, you asked, man.

510
00:44:03,789 --> 00:44:06,308
Come on. Read the file.

511
00:44:06,388 --> 00:44:10,548
Shelly Webster held on
for 30 hours in intensive care.

512
00:44:10,628 --> 00:44:13,707
Her body finally just gave it up.

513
00:44:13,747 --> 00:44:17,467
I saw it.
I couldn't do jack for her.

514
00:44:26,945 --> 00:44:28,785
- Hey.
- Don't touch me!

515
00:44:28,865 --> 00:44:32,705
- ( Sobbing )
- Hey.

516
00:44:34,065 --> 00:44:36,784
You okay?

517
00:44:36,824 --> 00:44:39,424
I saw her.

518
00:44:40,984 --> 00:44:44,143
I saw her
through your eyes.

519
00:44:44,223 --> 00:44:46,223
You stayed with her
the whole time.

520
00:44:46,303 --> 00:44:51,542
Yeah, well, you got to
understand something, all right?

521
00:44:51,622 --> 00:44:56,182
I was hoping
she'd come out of it, you know.

522
00:44:56,222 --> 00:44:59,061
Give me something
I could work with.

523
00:44:59,101 --> 00:45:01,261
Yeah.

524
00:45:01,301 --> 00:45:03,661
Look, I--

525
00:45:03,701 --> 00:45:06,100
Why didn't you do
something about it?

526
00:45:06,180 --> 00:45:09,380
You think any people in that building,
even the ones who signed the petition...

527
00:45:09,460 --> 00:45:12,779
would talk after
what happened to you?

528
00:45:12,859 --> 00:45:15,939
I kept asking
questions and...

529
00:45:16,019 --> 00:45:18,579
finally got busted for sticking
my nose where it wasn't wanted.

530
00:45:22,418 --> 00:45:24,298
This your wife?

531
00:45:24,378 --> 00:45:28,657
Yeah, we, uh-- Well, not anymore,
we're getting a divorce.

532
00:45:30,457 --> 00:45:33,297
It's funny.

533
00:45:33,337 --> 00:45:37,176
Little things used to mean
so much to Shelly.

534
00:45:37,256 --> 00:45:40,616
I used to think
they were kind of trivial.

535
00:45:40,696 --> 00:45:43,575
Believe me,
nothing is trivial.

536
00:45:52,814 --> 00:45:57,093
You shouldn't smoke these.
They'll kill you.

537
00:46:01,573 --> 00:46:04,652
You going to vanish
into thin air again?

538
00:46:08,132 --> 00:46:10,732
I thought I'd use
your front door.

539
00:46:13,651 --> 00:46:19,250
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what
happened to you and your girlfriend.

540
00:46:20,730 --> 00:46:22,970
Yeah.

541
00:46:27,329 --> 00:46:29,809
- ( Door Opening, Closing )
- ( Whispering ) Yeah.

542
00:46:29,889 --> 00:46:33,249
( Gideon ) I got stabbed!
I shot the son of a bitch!

543
00:46:33,329 --> 00:46:36,328
I watched the bullet hole
close by itself.

544
00:46:36,408 --> 00:46:39,328
And then my business
gets blown up real good.

545
00:46:39,408 --> 00:46:42,527
- Other than that, my day sucked.
- Yeah.

546
00:46:42,567 --> 00:46:45,007
I saw him too.
He had a guitar.

547
00:46:45,087 --> 00:46:49,326
He winked at me before he jumped out
a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

548
00:46:49,406 --> 00:46:54,206
He winked at ya?
Musicians.

549
00:46:54,286 --> 00:46:56,645
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

550
00:46:56,725 --> 00:46:59,125
shit about what you're going to do
about all this crap!

551
00:46:59,205 --> 00:47:04,484
What do I get? My livelihood
got flushed and went swirling.

552
00:47:04,564 --> 00:47:07,204
You ain't lost everything.

553
00:47:07,284 --> 00:47:12,163
Yeah, and maybe you're not
such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

554
00:47:12,243 --> 00:47:15,683
Fair enough. Catch.

555
00:47:16,763 --> 00:47:19,082
Aah! Jesus.

556
00:47:19,162 --> 00:47:21,482
Say hello to the last fellow
who wouldn't cooperate with me.

557
00:47:21,562 --> 00:47:23,482
What're you telling me,
this thing is real?

558
00:47:23,522 --> 00:47:27,041
All the power in the world
resides in the eyes, fella.

559
00:47:27,121 --> 00:47:30,921
Sometimes they're more useful
than the people who bear them.

560
00:47:31,001 --> 00:47:34,960
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

561
00:47:35,040 --> 00:47:37,600
Yeah.

562
00:47:37,640 --> 00:47:42,599
Eyes see. It's one of the most important
things I learned from my sister.

563
00:47:42,679 --> 00:47:45,799
Sister? She's supposed to be
your sister? ( Laughing )

564
00:47:45,879 --> 00:47:49,078
My father's daughter.
That's right.

565
00:47:49,158 --> 00:47:52,198
What's the matter,
you don't see the resemblance?

566
00:47:52,278 --> 00:47:54,438
Now, let's take it
from the top, friend.

567
00:47:54,518 --> 00:47:57,877
With a lot of detail.
What do you say?

568
00:47:57,997 --> 00:48:01,317
He had a bird with him.
Nearly pecked my face off.

569
00:48:01,397 --> 00:48:04,636
He told me to tell T-bird
that death was on its way.

570
00:48:04,716 --> 00:48:06,876
Whatever the fuck that means.

571
00:48:06,916 --> 00:48:10,556
Draven. He said his name
was Eric Draven.

572
00:48:11,595 --> 00:48:13,595
Want to relax
that thing now?

573
00:48:13,635 --> 00:48:18,115
This bird man, he just happened
to let you live, huh?

574
00:48:18,194 --> 00:48:22,394
You sure you ain't making all this up
just to save your own ass?

575
00:48:22,434 --> 00:48:25,034
I ain't making all this up.

576
00:48:25,114 --> 00:48:29,433
I ain't twisted
like you two fucks.

577
00:48:31,153 --> 00:48:33,192
All right.

578
00:48:37,672 --> 00:48:42,471
A boy and his bird.
Awful touching.

579
00:48:42,551 --> 00:48:46,071
Yeah. ( Laughing )

580
00:48:52,310 --> 00:48:55,190
For fuck's sake, die, will ya?
Give me that thing.

581
00:49:01,829 --> 00:49:04,068
Thanks.

582
00:49:04,108 --> 00:49:06,308
Funboy said he saw
a black bird too.

583
00:49:06,388 --> 00:49:08,868
A big one.

584
00:49:08,948 --> 00:49:13,627
Then he choked to death
on his own blood.

585
00:49:13,707 --> 00:49:17,467
I'll have the janitor
come on up.

586
00:49:21,706 --> 00:49:23,786
( Purring )

587
00:49:23,866 --> 00:49:28,585
** ( Electric Guitar )

588
00:49:39,584 --> 00:49:43,223
( Siren Wailing )

589
00:50:11,259 --> 00:50:16,619
- ** ( Rock Playing )
- ( Crow Caws )

590
00:50:16,699 --> 00:50:18,858
You again.

591
00:50:18,938 --> 00:50:21,218
You lost or hungry?

592
00:50:21,258 --> 00:50:23,978
- Hi.
- ( Caws )

593
00:50:26,217 --> 00:50:28,057
* It can't rain all the time *

594
00:50:28,137 --> 00:50:32,457
( Skipping )
* Can't rain all the time *

595
00:50:41,175 --> 00:50:43,775
( T-bird ) I don't know how many times I
gotta tell you. We're in this together!

596
00:50:43,855 --> 00:50:46,655
One part falls, it all falls!

597
00:50:46,735 --> 00:50:50,054
- You know how long it took us
to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

598
00:50:50,094 --> 00:50:52,574
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fucking voodoo doll!

599
00:50:52,654 --> 00:50:54,654
Tin Tin was a dick.

600
00:50:54,734 --> 00:50:57,573
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

601
00:50:57,653 --> 00:51:01,693
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

602
00:51:01,773 --> 00:51:03,612
Fire it up!

603
00:51:06,092 --> 00:51:08,092
No Funboy.

604
00:51:08,172 --> 00:51:11,931
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

605
00:51:12,011 --> 00:51:14,811
- ( Grunting )
- ( Whistles )

606
00:51:17,091 --> 00:51:20,050
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

607
00:51:20,130 --> 00:51:22,050
I'm on it.

608
00:51:27,409 --> 00:51:32,488
( Man Talking On Phone )

609
00:51:32,568 --> 00:51:35,408
( Sighs )

610
00:51:39,448 --> 00:51:41,767
( Cawing )

611
00:51:51,446 --> 00:51:54,885
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

612
00:51:54,965 --> 00:51:59,405
- ( Cawing )
- I'm your passenger.

613
00:52:06,004 --> 00:52:08,084
Drive.

614
00:52:10,083 --> 00:52:12,923
( Motor Starts )

615
00:52:12,963 --> 00:52:14,683
What's all this
happy horseshit?

616
00:52:14,763 --> 00:52:16,803
- ( Tires Screeching )
- Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

617
00:52:16,883 --> 00:52:20,002
- ( Horn Honking )
- ( Screams )

618
00:52:20,082 --> 00:52:21,922
( Brakes Screeching )

619
00:52:22,002 --> 00:52:25,121
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

620
00:52:25,201 --> 00:52:29,041
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

621
00:52:29,081 --> 00:52:31,241
( Groaning )

622
00:52:35,720 --> 00:52:39,959
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

623
00:52:41,519 --> 00:52:44,279
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

624
00:52:44,359 --> 00:52:47,318
- This is business, right?
- ( Gun Cocks ) Faster.

625
00:52:50,158 --> 00:52:54,198
You got that cream stuff?

626
00:52:54,238 --> 00:52:56,557
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

627
00:52:58,077 --> 00:53:00,957
- What in the crap--
- ( Tires Screech, Siren Wails )

628
00:53:00,997 --> 00:53:03,116
( Screaming )

629
00:53:04,316 --> 00:53:07,036
Oh, look. Making us popular.

630
00:53:07,076 --> 00:53:09,675
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

631
00:53:09,755 --> 00:53:14,955
( Siren Wailing )

632
00:53:15,035 --> 00:53:17,874
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

633
00:53:20,314 --> 00:53:22,394
Turn.

634
00:53:23,674 --> 00:53:26,313
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

635
00:53:26,393 --> 00:53:30,553
- Right? Huh?
- ( Crow Cawing )

636
00:53:32,032 --> 00:53:34,432
( Groans )
Damn! Dead end!

637
00:53:34,472 --> 00:53:36,632
( Cawing )

638
00:53:39,591 --> 00:53:41,951
- ( Man ) Look out!
- ( Woman Screams )

639
00:53:45,151 --> 00:53:47,270
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

640
00:53:57,909 --> 00:54:01,988
- ( Engine Rattling )
- Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

641
00:54:02,068 --> 00:54:05,468
( Siren Wailing )

642
00:54:05,508 --> 00:54:07,908
Shit! Shit!

643
00:54:14,747 --> 00:54:18,306
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

644
00:54:19,666 --> 00:54:22,986
T-bird!
I got you, man!

645
00:54:23,066 --> 00:54:25,345
- Shit!
- ( Screaming )

646
00:54:28,985 --> 00:54:33,784
( Groaning, Car Door Chiming )

647
00:54:38,184 --> 00:54:40,383
( T-bird ) Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

648
00:54:40,463 --> 00:54:43,583
But I don't know what--
What? Huh? What?

649
00:54:43,623 --> 00:54:46,303
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

650
00:54:46,343 --> 00:54:49,342
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

651
00:54:49,382 --> 00:54:51,462
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

652
00:54:51,542 --> 00:54:54,661
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

653
00:54:54,741 --> 00:54:58,181
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

654
00:54:58,261 --> 00:55:01,540
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

655
00:55:01,620 --> 00:55:04,740
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

656
00:55:04,820 --> 00:55:09,539
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

657
00:55:11,059 --> 00:55:12,859
Did you send us
these complaints?

658
00:55:14,499 --> 00:55:17,698
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

659
00:55:17,738 --> 00:55:20,018
Does it get you sweaty?

660
00:55:20,098 --> 00:55:25,097
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

661
00:55:25,137 --> 00:55:29,057
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

662
00:55:29,217 --> 00:55:32,976
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

663
00:55:33,056 --> 00:55:36,376
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

664
00:55:36,416 --> 00:55:38,696
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

665
00:55:38,775 --> 00:55:43,055
( Grunting, Muttering )
T-bird--

666
00:55:43,135 --> 00:55:45,975
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

667
00:55:48,414 --> 00:55:52,414
- T-bird.
- ( T-bird Panting )

668
00:55:52,494 --> 00:55:55,733
- ( Engine Revs )
- "Abashed the devil stood...

669
00:55:55,773 --> 00:55:58,613
and felt how awful goodness is."

670
00:55:58,693 --> 00:56:01,452
"And felt how awful goodness is."

671
00:56:06,012 --> 00:56:09,851
( Tires Squealing )

672
00:56:14,931 --> 00:56:17,410
( Gasping )
T-bird. T-bird.

673
00:56:44,007 --> 00:56:47,166
( Crow Caws )

674
00:57:05,724 --> 00:57:07,924
( Woman ) This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

675
00:57:08,004 --> 00:57:10,243
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

676
00:57:10,283 --> 00:57:14,483
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

677
00:57:14,563 --> 00:57:17,842
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

678
00:57:17,922 --> 00:57:23,082
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

679
00:57:23,122 --> 00:57:28,081
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

680
00:57:28,161 --> 00:57:31,640
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties--

681
00:57:31,720 --> 00:57:35,360
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

682
00:57:37,320 --> 00:57:39,919
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

683
00:57:39,999 --> 00:57:44,719
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

684
00:57:44,799 --> 00:57:48,758
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

685
00:57:48,838 --> 00:57:52,038
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

686
00:57:52,078 --> 00:57:56,997
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

687
00:57:57,037 --> 00:58:02,596
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

688
00:58:02,636 --> 00:58:07,676
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

689
00:58:10,075 --> 00:58:14,195
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

690
00:58:14,275 --> 00:58:16,394
Over easy.

691
00:58:18,394 --> 00:58:22,914
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

692
00:58:33,072 --> 00:58:35,232
Hey, Albrecht.

693
00:58:35,312 --> 00:58:37,792
( Sighs )

694
00:58:37,872 --> 00:58:40,671
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

695
00:58:40,751 --> 00:58:43,871
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

696
00:58:43,951 --> 00:58:47,990
- We're gonna have to l.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

697
00:58:48,070 --> 00:58:49,910
Arson was his specialty.

698
00:58:49,990 --> 00:58:51,870
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

699
00:58:51,950 --> 00:58:55,709
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'-shit.

700
00:58:55,789 --> 00:58:57,949
Come here.

701
00:59:01,548 --> 00:59:03,428
You're holding out on me.

702
00:59:03,508 --> 00:59:06,908
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

703
00:59:06,988 --> 00:59:10,107
and you're covering up
for somebody.

704
00:59:10,187 --> 00:59:12,507
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

705
00:59:12,587 --> 00:59:16,306
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

706
00:59:16,386 --> 00:59:18,426
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

707
00:59:18,506 --> 00:59:21,266
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

708
00:59:21,306 --> 00:59:24,145
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

709
00:59:24,225 --> 00:59:26,065
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

710
00:59:26,145 --> 00:59:28,345
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

711
00:59:28,425 --> 00:59:30,344
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

712
00:59:30,424 --> 00:59:32,344
You gotta write that shit down.

713
00:59:32,384 --> 00:59:34,264
All right, smart-ass.

714
00:59:34,304 --> 00:59:37,264
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

715
00:59:37,304 --> 00:59:41,103
- Welcome to the first day
of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

716
00:59:41,143 --> 00:59:44,743
- For what?
- Misconduct.

717
00:59:44,823 --> 00:59:48,662
( Dials Phone )
Yeah, give me the lab.

718
00:59:48,742 --> 00:59:53,141
( Thunder Rumbling )

719
01:00:02,980 --> 01:00:04,820
( Grunting )

720
01:00:29,977 --> 01:00:33,696
** ( Electric Guitar )

721
01:00:37,336 --> 01:00:39,815
( Shelly ) One for sorrow,
two for joy...

722
01:00:39,895 --> 01:00:42,615
- Come here.
- ...three for a girl, four for a boy.

723
01:00:47,454 --> 01:00:51,094
Dancing--

724
01:01:00,892 --> 01:01:03,532
( Paper Ripping )

725
01:01:20,930 --> 01:01:22,809
Eric?

726
01:01:22,849 --> 01:01:25,369
( Rain Falling )

727
01:01:25,409 --> 01:01:29,529
( Sighs ) Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

728
01:01:29,569 --> 01:01:32,408
- Gabriel.
- ( Meows )

729
01:01:32,448 --> 01:01:35,128
I thought you were dead.

730
01:01:35,168 --> 01:01:38,327
You're not dead, are you?

731
01:02:02,084 --> 01:02:04,884
I knew it was you.

732
01:02:06,724 --> 01:02:09,523
Even with the makeup.

733
01:02:14,163 --> 01:02:16,642
I remembered your song.

734
01:02:16,722 --> 01:02:20,322
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

735
01:02:20,402 --> 01:02:23,521
That is from your song, right?

736
01:02:33,040 --> 01:02:36,040
- ( Cawing )
- Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

737
01:02:38,319 --> 01:02:42,239
I miss you...
and Shelly.

738
01:02:45,198 --> 01:02:48,518
Get so lonely
all by myself.

739
01:02:50,278 --> 01:02:54,717
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

740
01:02:54,797 --> 01:02:57,797
Sarah, I do care.

741
01:03:08,555 --> 01:03:10,595
That's him.
That's him!

742
01:03:10,675 --> 01:03:13,875
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

743
01:03:13,955 --> 01:03:17,074
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

744
01:03:17,154 --> 01:03:19,594
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

745
01:03:19,674 --> 01:03:22,353
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

746
01:03:22,433 --> 01:03:25,793
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

747
01:03:25,873 --> 01:03:29,632
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

748
01:03:30,912 --> 01:03:35,312
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

749
01:03:35,392 --> 01:03:37,871
- Empty.
- Fire it--

750
01:03:37,951 --> 01:03:39,791
Grave?
What grave?

751
01:03:39,871 --> 01:03:41,991
What about
my fucking grave?

752
01:03:42,071 --> 01:03:43,351
- ( Screams )
- Three out of four.

753
01:03:43,431 --> 01:03:46,550
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

754
01:03:46,630 --> 01:03:49,150
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

755
01:03:49,230 --> 01:03:52,269
That boy was out of control.
T-bird, he came in, he says...
( Whistles )

756
01:03:52,349 --> 01:03:55,509
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

757
01:03:55,589 --> 01:03:59,308
( Groaning )

758
01:03:59,388 --> 01:04:02,348
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

759
01:04:02,428 --> 01:04:06,028
- This ghost gonna kill--
- Hey.

760
01:04:06,108 --> 01:04:07,987
That ain't no ghost.

761
01:04:09,827 --> 01:04:12,867
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

762
01:04:12,907 --> 01:04:14,826
We might need him.

763
01:04:16,266 --> 01:04:18,626
Ghost gonna kill my--

764
01:04:30,824 --> 01:04:34,624
He like his plain
or with onions?

765
01:04:34,664 --> 01:04:37,983
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

766
01:04:38,023 --> 01:04:41,983
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

767
01:04:42,023 --> 01:04:44,542
That's what I thought.

768
01:04:44,582 --> 01:04:47,262
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

769
01:04:47,302 --> 01:04:49,502
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

770
01:04:49,542 --> 01:04:53,021
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

771
01:04:53,101 --> 01:04:58,221
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

772
01:04:58,301 --> 01:05:01,660
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

773
01:05:01,740 --> 01:05:04,540
Eric didn't come back for me.

774
01:05:04,620 --> 01:05:09,179
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

775
01:05:09,259 --> 01:05:12,299
You want a friend
to walk you home?

776
01:05:12,379 --> 01:05:17,418
** ( Electric Guitar )

777
01:05:41,575 --> 01:05:44,454
- ( Screaming )
- * I am the wicked
I am the wave of the future *

778
01:05:56,973 --> 01:05:58,852
( Woman ) * Being crucified *

779
01:05:58,892 --> 01:06:03,052
* You things, things
things of the flesh *

780
01:06:03,092 --> 01:06:05,692
* Do it slow *

781
01:06:05,772 --> 01:06:09,891
* Down avenues "cut me" *

782
01:06:09,971 --> 01:06:13,491
* Lust my eyes *

783
01:06:13,571 --> 01:06:19,570
* Licking lips encouraging
Mr. Careworn *

784
01:06:19,650 --> 01:06:25,529
* To gaze upon the screen bask on *

785
01:06:25,609 --> 01:06:27,529
* After the flesh **

786
01:06:39,047 --> 01:06:42,487
( Whimpering )

787
01:06:42,567 --> 01:06:45,366
Boys.

788
01:06:45,446 --> 01:06:48,726
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

789
01:06:48,806 --> 01:06:50,806
on account of
a slight case of death.

790
01:06:50,886 --> 01:06:52,765
- ( Men Chuckling )
- You wanna sit down?

791
01:06:52,845 --> 01:06:58,005
- ( Groaning )
- Well, well, well.

792
01:06:58,045 --> 01:07:01,004
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

793
01:07:01,044 --> 01:07:02,924
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

794
01:07:02,964 --> 01:07:06,123
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

795
01:07:06,163 --> 01:07:08,323
I like the pretty lights.

796
01:07:08,403 --> 01:07:11,123
( Laughing )

797
01:07:11,203 --> 01:07:14,962
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

798
01:07:15,002 --> 01:07:20,002
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

799
01:07:20,082 --> 01:07:22,361
Only reason to quit.

800
01:07:22,441 --> 01:07:27,721
A man has an idea.

801
01:07:27,801 --> 01:07:29,960
The idea attracts others...

802
01:07:30,040 --> 01:07:32,040
like-minded.

803
01:07:32,120 --> 01:07:34,120
The idea expands.

804
01:07:34,200 --> 01:07:37,679
The idea becomes
an institution.

805
01:07:37,759 --> 01:07:40,319
What was the idea?

806
01:07:40,399 --> 01:07:43,998
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

807
01:07:44,078 --> 01:07:46,758
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

808
01:07:46,838 --> 01:07:49,798
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

809
01:07:49,878 --> 01:07:51,957
You see, gentlemen...

810
01:07:52,037 --> 01:07:56,837
greed is for amateurs.

811
01:07:56,917 --> 01:08:01,876
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

812
01:08:01,956 --> 01:08:04,436
now that's fun!

813
01:08:04,516 --> 01:08:06,715
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

814
01:08:06,795 --> 01:08:10,075
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

815
01:08:10,115 --> 01:08:13,075
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

816
01:08:13,154 --> 01:08:16,474
Do you know
what they got now?

817
01:08:16,514 --> 01:08:20,633
Devil's Night greeting cards.

818
01:08:20,673 --> 01:08:23,513
Isn't that precious?

819
01:08:23,553 --> 01:08:25,593
Yeah.

820
01:08:25,633 --> 01:08:30,232
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

821
01:08:30,272 --> 01:08:32,232
Time to move along.

822
01:08:32,312 --> 01:08:34,632
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

823
01:08:34,712 --> 01:08:37,111
No.

824
01:08:37,151 --> 01:08:39,671
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

825
01:08:39,711 --> 01:08:42,711
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

826
01:08:42,751 --> 01:08:45,270
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

827
01:08:45,310 --> 01:08:49,590
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

828
01:08:49,630 --> 01:08:51,669
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

829
01:08:51,709 --> 01:08:53,589
Skank!
You don't feel that?

830
01:08:53,629 --> 01:08:56,829
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.
- ( All Laughing )

831
01:08:56,869 --> 01:08:59,188
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook."

832
01:08:59,268 --> 01:09:03,468
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

833
01:09:03,548 --> 01:09:05,787
- ( Crow Caws )
- ( Gasps )

834
01:09:05,827 --> 01:09:08,347
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

835
01:09:09,707 --> 01:09:12,107
- Gentlemen.
- ( Skank Screams )

836
01:09:12,187 --> 01:09:16,626
( Skank Whimpering ) Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

837
01:09:20,985 --> 01:09:24,625
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

838
01:09:24,665 --> 01:09:27,065
The killer of killers.

839
01:09:27,145 --> 01:09:29,864
- Nice outfit.
- ( Whimpering )

840
01:09:29,944 --> 01:09:31,904
I'm not sure
about the face though.

841
01:09:31,984 --> 01:09:33,944
I just want him.

842
01:09:34,024 --> 01:09:37,303
- ( Whimpering )
- Well, you can't have him.

843
01:09:37,383 --> 01:09:39,943
Well...

844
01:09:41,943 --> 01:09:44,302
I see you have
made your decision.

845
01:09:45,822 --> 01:09:47,702
Now let's see you enforce it.

846
01:09:47,782 --> 01:09:51,301
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

847
01:09:56,941 --> 01:10:00,700
Ooh, that had to hurt.

848
01:10:00,780 --> 01:10:03,460
- ( All Laughing )
- Well, that's that.

849
01:10:03,540 --> 01:10:06,579
- ( Laughing Continues )
- That guy was crazy.

850
01:10:08,819 --> 01:10:11,539
( Caws )

851
01:10:12,938 --> 01:10:14,658
He's gone.
( Screams )

852
01:10:14,738 --> 01:10:20,177
( Screaming, Gunfire )

853
01:10:22,377 --> 01:10:24,017
Get him!

854
01:10:29,256 --> 01:10:32,576
- ( Whimpering )
- ( Gunfire )

855
01:10:40,575 --> 01:10:43,254
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

856
01:10:47,134 --> 01:10:49,054
Jesus Christ!

857
01:11:04,812 --> 01:11:06,691
Hey!

858
01:11:37,887 --> 01:11:40,127
You're all going to die.

859
01:11:51,045 --> 01:11:54,445
( Screaming )

860
01:11:54,525 --> 01:11:57,244
( Man ) Get the fuck outta here!

861
01:12:09,003 --> 01:12:11,483
( Crowd Screaming )

862
01:12:11,563 --> 01:12:16,802
( Whimpering, Gasping )

863
01:12:21,241 --> 01:12:26,001
( Whimpering )

864
01:12:26,081 --> 01:12:27,520
( Screams )

865
01:12:31,560 --> 01:12:34,360
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

866
01:12:34,440 --> 01:12:37,519
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

867
01:12:37,599 --> 01:12:41,319
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

868
01:12:41,399 --> 01:12:43,118
( Screaming ) No!

869
01:12:43,198 --> 01:12:47,478
( Whimpering )

870
01:12:47,558 --> 01:12:51,077
- ( Body Crashing )
- What in the crap--

871
01:12:52,357 --> 01:12:54,877
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

872
01:12:54,957 --> 01:12:58,236
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

873
01:13:04,835 --> 01:13:06,915
( Siren Blaring )

874
01:13:06,955 --> 01:13:09,715
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

875
01:13:09,795 --> 01:13:12,954
( Gunfire Continues )

876
01:13:13,034 --> 01:13:16,514
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

877
01:13:16,594 --> 01:13:18,634
...arms and legs--

878
01:13:23,953 --> 01:13:28,552
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs--

879
01:14:07,507 --> 01:14:11,946
- ( Tires Screeching )
- Come on! Move it!

880
01:14:16,186 --> 01:14:19,185
My advice:
Next time duck.

881
01:14:21,145 --> 01:14:23,425
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

882
01:14:23,505 --> 01:14:26,704
- ( Sirens Wailing )
- ( Brakes Screeching )

883
01:14:26,744 --> 01:14:29,744
- Shit!
- ( Door Opening )

884
01:14:32,504 --> 01:14:35,303
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

885
01:14:35,383 --> 01:14:37,743
Look at that out there.

886
01:14:37,783 --> 01:14:40,623
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

887
01:14:40,663 --> 01:14:43,742
Sky oughta be red.

888
01:14:43,822 --> 01:14:47,982
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

889
01:14:48,022 --> 01:14:53,501
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

890
01:14:53,581 --> 01:14:56,420
- I like him already.
- The crow...

891
01:14:56,500 --> 01:15:00,780
is his link between
the land of the living...

892
01:15:00,860 --> 01:15:03,100
and the realm of the dead.

893
01:15:03,180 --> 01:15:07,539
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

894
01:15:07,579 --> 01:15:09,499
Hmm.

895
01:15:31,656 --> 01:15:33,576
I'm coming home, Shelly.

896
01:15:33,656 --> 01:15:35,735
( Laughing )

897
01:15:35,815 --> 01:15:41,294
( Laughing Continues )

898
01:15:41,374 --> 01:15:43,254
( Chuckles )

899
01:15:47,334 --> 01:15:51,373
( Children Laughing, Hooting )

900
01:15:51,453 --> 01:15:55,533
( Laughing )

901
01:16:20,649 --> 01:16:23,009
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

902
01:16:23,049 --> 01:16:25,049
in the middle
of the night, right?

903
01:16:25,089 --> 01:16:26,808
Safest place in the world to be.

904
01:16:26,848 --> 01:16:31,448
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

905
01:16:31,488 --> 01:16:35,487
It's really late, Sarah.

906
01:16:35,567 --> 01:16:38,207
You didn't say good-bye.

907
01:16:38,327 --> 01:16:42,126
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

908
01:16:42,206 --> 01:16:46,286
And you're never coming back.

909
01:16:52,325 --> 01:16:55,445
I gave this to Shelly once.

910
01:16:59,004 --> 01:17:01,844
I think she'd like you
to have it.

911
01:17:05,723 --> 01:17:07,923
This way you'll
always remember her.

912
01:17:07,963 --> 01:17:10,443
I'll never take it off.

913
01:17:27,840 --> 01:17:31,520
I better go sneak
back in the house.

914
01:17:37,399 --> 01:17:39,279
Bye.

915
01:17:58,436 --> 01:18:01,156
- ( Muffled Screaming )
- Shh! Shh!

916
01:18:02,996 --> 01:18:05,315
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

917
01:18:05,355 --> 01:18:09,955
( Muffled Screaming Continues )

918
01:18:11,954 --> 01:18:14,314
Come on.
Come on.

919
01:18:27,072 --> 01:18:31,032
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

920
01:18:32,552 --> 01:18:35,551
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

921
01:18:41,710 --> 01:18:44,870
Her eyes are so innocent.

922
01:18:55,748 --> 01:18:57,628
- ( Sarah ) Eric!
- ( Caws )

923
01:18:57,668 --> 01:19:01,468
Eric, help! Eric!

924
01:19:04,907 --> 01:19:07,907
( Thunderclap )

925
01:19:09,867 --> 01:19:11,706
( Crow Caws )

926
01:19:25,065 --> 01:19:27,184
( Crow Flapping, Caws )

927
01:19:39,303 --> 01:19:42,382
Quick impression for ya.

928
01:19:42,462 --> 01:19:46,022
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

929
01:19:46,102 --> 01:19:49,301
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

930
01:19:49,381 --> 01:19:52,301
( Inhales )
Well, well.

931
01:19:52,381 --> 01:19:55,980
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

932
01:20:00,260 --> 01:20:02,580
( Cawing )

933
01:20:03,619 --> 01:20:05,819
Nah. Fuck it.

934
01:20:11,578 --> 01:20:13,858
( Chuckles )

935
01:20:13,938 --> 01:20:15,978
Aw, fuck.

936
01:20:19,057 --> 01:20:22,857
( Muffled Screaming )

937
01:20:22,937 --> 01:20:27,296
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

938
01:20:27,376 --> 01:20:31,056
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

939
01:20:31,136 --> 01:20:35,135
( Groaning )

940
01:20:35,215 --> 01:20:38,455
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

941
01:20:41,854 --> 01:20:44,014
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

942
01:20:45,614 --> 01:20:47,733
Bye-bye, birdie.

943
01:21:30,968 --> 01:21:33,007
Ah, shit.

944
01:21:33,047 --> 01:21:35,087
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

945
01:21:35,127 --> 01:21:37,087
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

946
01:21:37,167 --> 01:21:39,647
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

947
01:21:39,726 --> 01:21:41,646
Two more.
( Groans )

948
01:21:41,686 --> 01:21:43,606
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

949
01:21:43,686 --> 01:21:46,126
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

950
01:21:46,166 --> 01:21:48,845
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

951
01:21:48,885 --> 01:21:52,485
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

952
01:21:55,004 --> 01:21:58,404
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

953
01:21:58,484 --> 01:22:00,444
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

954
01:22:00,524 --> 01:22:03,843
I was.
I'm not anymore.

955
01:22:03,923 --> 01:22:07,963
( Sighs ) Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

956
01:22:08,043 --> 01:22:10,842
- Come on.
- ( Groaning )

957
01:22:13,402 --> 01:22:15,362
You take that.

958
01:22:44,198 --> 01:22:47,517
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

959
01:23:08,755 --> 01:23:10,554
( Crow Caws )

960
01:23:10,634 --> 01:23:13,754
This is all the power
you ever had.

961
01:23:13,794 --> 01:23:15,834
Now it is mine.

962
01:23:15,874 --> 01:23:19,433
Pity there's not more time...

963
01:23:19,513 --> 01:23:22,033
- ( Gun Cocks )
- ...for us.

964
01:23:23,393 --> 01:23:28,912
( Woman Screaming )

965
01:23:30,512 --> 01:23:34,271
( Screaming )

966
01:23:35,551 --> 01:23:39,350
( Screaming Continues )

967
01:23:39,430 --> 01:23:42,150
( Sarah ) Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

968
01:23:44,190 --> 01:23:46,630
Let me go!

969
01:23:55,348 --> 01:23:58,748
Let her go!

970
01:23:58,788 --> 01:24:01,587
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

971
01:24:01,587 --> 01:24:03,227
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

972
01:24:03,267 --> 01:24:05,187
All right.

973
01:24:05,267 --> 01:24:07,227
- ( Sarah Screams )
- No!

974
01:24:10,866 --> 01:24:15,986
( Gasping, Groaning )

975
01:24:18,185 --> 01:24:20,145
( Crow Caws )

976
01:24:20,225 --> 01:24:22,505
( Thunderclap )

977
01:24:22,545 --> 01:24:24,784
( Gasping )

978
01:24:24,864 --> 01:24:26,904
- ( Thunderclap )
- ( Screams )

979
01:24:45,742 --> 01:24:48,501
( Swords Clanking )

980
01:24:48,581 --> 01:24:51,661
- ( Whimpering )
- ( Roof Collapsing )

981
01:24:51,741 --> 01:24:53,141
Eric!

982
01:24:55,420 --> 01:24:59,500
- ( Groaning )
- ( Laughing )

983
01:25:10,978 --> 01:25:14,178
- Sarah?
- Look out!

984
01:25:17,617 --> 01:25:20,977
- ( Panting )
- Eric!

985
01:25:28,656 --> 01:25:30,736
You know,
my daddy used to say...

986
01:25:30,816 --> 01:25:33,215
"Every man's got a devil...

987
01:25:33,295 --> 01:25:35,335
and you can't rest
till you find him."

988
01:25:35,415 --> 01:25:37,855
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend--

989
01:25:37,935 --> 01:25:40,734
I cleared that building.

990
01:25:40,814 --> 01:25:43,934
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

991
01:25:44,014 --> 01:25:46,733
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

992
01:25:46,813 --> 01:25:49,533
But if it's any consolation
to you...

993
01:25:49,613 --> 01:25:53,093
you have put
a smile on my face.

994
01:25:53,173 --> 01:25:55,692
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

995
01:25:55,732 --> 01:25:58,252
( Unsheathes Knife )
I am going to miss you.

996
01:25:58,292 --> 01:26:00,732
I have something
to give you.

997
01:26:00,812 --> 01:26:03,091
I don't want it anymore.

998
01:26:07,411 --> 01:26:10,290
Thirty hours of pain!

999
01:26:12,530 --> 01:26:15,130
- All at once!
- ( Groaning )

1000
01:26:15,210 --> 01:26:18,089
- ( Steady Tone )
- All for you.

1001
01:26:31,367 --> 01:26:34,647
( Gasping )

1002
01:26:42,646 --> 01:26:45,686
Yeah.

1003
01:26:52,245 --> 01:26:54,964
Go help him.

1004
01:26:58,164 --> 01:27:00,364
Are you alive?

1005
01:27:02,283 --> 01:27:06,123
( Groans )
God, I need a cigarette.

1006
01:27:11,842 --> 01:27:13,722
Everybody else dead?

1007
01:27:13,762 --> 01:27:15,961
You helped me.

1008
01:27:16,041 --> 01:27:18,481
What you kept in here
saved me.

1009
01:27:18,561 --> 01:27:21,561
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

1010
01:27:21,641 --> 01:27:24,520
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

1011
01:27:29,320 --> 01:27:31,959
Oh, yuck.
( Spits )

1012
01:27:32,039 --> 01:27:36,839
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

1013
01:27:44,958 --> 01:27:48,277
Stay with him
until help comes.

1014
01:27:48,317 --> 01:27:51,637
He'll be okay, right?

1015
01:27:51,717 --> 01:27:53,836
Eric?

1016
01:27:55,236 --> 01:27:58,676
( Sighs )
He does that a lot.

1017
01:28:00,476 --> 01:28:05,235
( Distant Sirens Approaching )

1018
01:28:05,315 --> 01:28:08,634
( Gasping, Groaning )

1019
01:28:08,674 --> 01:28:11,674
( Tires Screeching )

1020
01:28:14,274 --> 01:28:16,633
Shelly.

1021
01:28:28,352 --> 01:28:32,991
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

1022
01:28:33,071 --> 01:28:35,671
At least it stopped raining, huh?

1023
01:28:35,711 --> 01:28:38,990
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

1024
01:28:39,070 --> 01:28:42,270
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

1025
01:28:42,310 --> 01:28:44,190
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

1026
01:28:44,230 --> 01:28:48,629
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

1027
01:28:48,709 --> 01:28:50,669
You missed it.

1028
01:28:50,749 --> 01:28:53,308
Get him outta here!

1029
01:28:53,388 --> 01:28:55,868
( Chuckling )

1030
01:29:54,860 --> 01:29:56,740
Thanks.

1031
01:30:01,739 --> 01:30:04,659
( Sarah ) If the people we love
are stolen from us...

1032
01:30:04,739 --> 01:30:09,618
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

1033
01:30:09,698 --> 01:30:15,337
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.
